# Ma! (He's Making Eyes at Me)__disambig_1

| producer     = Tommy Scott
| prev_title   =

| next_title   = If My Friends Could See Me Now
| next_year    = 1974

'Ma! (He's Making Eyes at Me)' is the debut album by Scottish singer Lena Zavaroni, released in 1974 on Philips Records. The record was a hit and made Zavaroni the youngest artist to have a record in the Top 10 UK albums chart, a distinction she still holds.
Track listing
# "Ma! (He's Making Eyes at Me)" (Con Conrad, Sidney Clare)
# "The End of the World" (Sylvia Dee, Arthur Kent)
# "Swinging on a Star" (Johnny Burke, Jimmy Van Heusen)
# "Help Me Make It Through the Night" (Kris Kristofferson)
# "Cross My Heart" (Scott)
# "My Mammy" (Walter Donaldson, Sam M. Lewis, Joe Young)
# "Rock-A-Bye Your Baby (with a Dixie Melody)" (Sam M. Lewis, Joe Young, Jean Schwartz)
# "Country Roads" (John Denver)
# "Pennies from Heaven" (Arthur Johnstone)
# "Love Can Make the World Go Around" (Scott)
# "My Happiness" (Borney Bergantine, Betty Peterson)
# "River Deep Mountain High" (Phil Spector, Ellie Greenwich, Jeff Barry)
